alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Swisher; Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 29 at 4:36AM CDT until March 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE SOUTH PLAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE SOUTH PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Friday morning through Friday evening. * Timing...Noon to 10 PM CDT for the Fire Weather Watch on Thursday. For Friday`s Fire Weather Watch 9 AM to 10 PM CDT. * Wind...South to southwest at 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph on Thursday. West at 30-40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph on Friday. * Humidity...As low as 10 percent on Thursday. As low as 8 percent on Friday. * Fuels...Critically Dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
